text.title: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger

head.s: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger

p.s: Unless you 're living in your own home , you may find yourself wishing for a larger bathroom .
While it ’s not a problem for homeowners to completely remodel and redecorate , apartment renters are rather limited .
It can be a challenge , because you have to work with what is provided .
There ’s still a lot you can do without replacing tiles or knocking down walls .
With a little bit of planning , some creative organizational skills and clever use of color , you can easily make your apartment bathroom seem more spacious than it really is .
These simple decorating tips are quick , easy , and best of all , cheap .

item.s: If your landlord approves , you may be able to paint .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 1.jpg

item.s: Colors of the same tone create an illusion of greater space .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 2.jpg

item.s: Choose soft , pale , neutral pastels for both the walls and the flooring .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 3.jpg

item.s: Use a large rug to cover dark or unflattering floor tiles .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 4.jpg

item.s: Bright , strong and exciting colors ( such as red ) should be saved for accessories and towels .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 5.jpg

p.s: Mirrors provide an illusion of expansion without adding a single square foot .

item.s: Consider a few small mirrors arranged artistically throughout the room .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 6.jpg

item.s: Replace a bulky medicine chest with a wall mirror .
Store a first-aid kit in a kitchen cupboard .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 7.jpg

item.s: Try one full-length mirror on the back of the bathroom door .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 8.jpg

p.s: A clean , neat bathroom will always look bigger .
Yes , this means you ’ll have to spend some serious time organizing your stuff .

item.s: Cut down on the number of towels , rugs , pieces of art and decorative accessories .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 9.jpg

item.s: Use one large rug or runner instead of several small rugs .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 10.jpg

item.s: Items that are infrequently used should be stored out of sight .
This does n’t mean you have to hide everything out of sight , though .
There are plenty of attractive smaller storage options that allow you to put your items in place and on display at the same time .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 11.jpg

item.s: Tall and thin cabinets always come in handy when space is at a premium .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 12.jpg

item.s: Vertical displays also create an illusion of greater space in height .
Narrow shelving over the toilet will not impinge upon floor space .
Fold towels in thirds to stack neatly on the shelves .
Store cosmetics in a basket on the shelf .
Include a toothbrush case , toothpaste and a small glass in a separate basket .
Place the more cluttered basket on a higher shelf so that the contents will not be within view .
Provide space for a tissue box .
Keep these shelves limited to a few items that require quick access on a daily basis .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 13.jpg

item.s: Avoid multiple dispensers and holders around the sink . #Replace a wide soap dish with a thin liquid soap dispenser .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 14.jpg

item.s: Place a towel hook near shower and sink .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 15.jpg

item.s: Place a garment hook on the back of the bathroom door .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 16.jpg

item.s: Try to avoid using a rack with multiple hooks in an already crowded space .
One hook and one item on the hook provides for a neat appearance .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 17.jpg

item.s: Once dressed , remove all garments from the bathroom .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 18.jpg

item.s: Decide what items can be kept elsewhere - other than in the bathroom .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 19.jpg

item.s: Store your bathrobe on a hook in your bedroom closet instead of on the back of the bathroom door .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 20.jpg

item.s: Store your laundry in a pillowcase hung on a hook in your bedroom closet .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 21.jpg

item.s: Store your scale beneath your bed or a bedroom chair .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 22.jpg

list.item:
With a single swoop of the arm – push back the shower curtain to one side when it ’s not in use .
If you can see all the way to the back wall ( instead of just to the curtain ) , your eye will think the room is larger .

item.s: One sheer curtain covering the entire window will provide privacy and abundant light during the day .
A shade behind the curtain can be pulled down at night .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 24.jpg

item.s: If fixtures are being replaced , consider a small corner sink .

figure.rend: Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger Step 25.jpg
